result.execSummary:
The defendant Alesha M Momon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent with credit for 5 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Mental health assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" for victims of domestic abuse counseling.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but ordered it waived.  The DNA surcharge is waived as no DNA sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alesha M Momon in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Alesha M Momon in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 4.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Steven B.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Mental health assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" for victims of domestic abuse counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable but ordered it waived.  The DNA surcharge is waived as no DNA sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred to branch 40 for Sentencing hearing.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
-- Missed Office Contact: 5-1-2015.   mld
Defense motion to modify conditions of Justice Point monitoring to 2 office visits per month.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charge in COUNT 1 and the original charge in COUNT 2 and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty on both counts and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Alesha M Momon in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 be amended to a Class A Misdemeanor Battery pursuant to Wis. Stats. 940.19(1).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alesha M Momon in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-24-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Deonta P., and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.  mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Alesha M Momon in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant stated on the record, that the correct spelling of her last name is MOMON.  Name corrected on CCAP.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-19-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Deonta P., absolute sobriety, no possessions of firearms or weapons, and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Defendant waived preliminary hearing.  Signed Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver signed and filed.  Court bound defendant over for trial.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING BREATHALYZER TESTS AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEONTA P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alesha M Mormon in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Alesha M Mormon in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
